Title.evidence: Title: Randomised Controlled Trial of Pharmacological Interventions to Accelerate Rocuronium Onset Time

Intervention.evidence: Effective interventions included rocuronium priming, ephedrine pretreatment, and magnesium sulphate pretreatment.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to identify effective pharmacological interventions to accelerate rocuronium onset time.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the onset time of rocuronium-induced neuromuscular blockade.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Forty-three trials with 2,465 patients were included.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Effective interventions included rocuronium priming (MD −21.0 s, 95% CI −27.6 to −14.3 s), ephedrine pretreatment (MD −22.3 s, 95% CI −29.1 to −15.5 s), and magnesium sulphate pretreatment (MD −28.2 s, 95% CI −50.9 to −5.6 s).

Harms.evidence: No significant adverse events were reported.
